plantuml_diagram:
@startuml
!define AWSPuml https://raw.githubusercontent.com/awslabs/aws-icons-for-plantuml/v20.0/dist
!include AWSPuml/AWSCommon.puml

title High-level Deployment Architecture (Go + Kubernetes + Istio + OpenTelemetry)

skinparam shadowing false
skinparam componentStyle rectangle
skinparam wrapWidth 220
skinparam maxMessageSize 120

actor "Client" as client

cloud "Kubernetes Cluster" as k8s {
  node "Istio Ingress Gateway\n(istio-ingress/ingress-gateway)" as istio_gw

  frame "Namespace: app" as ns_app {
    node "Service1 Pod(s)" as pod_svc1 {
      artifact "svc1 container\nGo (fuego HTTP API)\nOpenTelemetry SDK" as svc1
    }

    node "Service2 Pod(s)" as pod_svc2 {
      artifact "svc2 container\nGo (fuego HTTP API)\nOpenTelemetry SDK\nProxy client" as svc2
    }

    database "K8s Service\nmy-go-app-service:8080\n(ClusterIP)" as svc1_svc
    database "K8s Service\nmy-go-app-service2:8080\n(ClusterIP)" as svc2_svc

    rectangle "Istio VirtualService\n(vs-svc1)" as vs1
    rectangle "Istio VirtualService\n(vs-svc2)" as vs2

    rectangle "K8s Ingress\n(ingress-svc1)" as ing1
    rectangle "K8s Ingress\n(ingress-svc2)" as ing2
  }

  frame "Namespace: monitoring" as ns_mon {
    node "Grafana Tempo\n(tempo-distributor)" as tempo {
      artifact "OTLP/HTTP endpoint\n:4318" as otlp
    }
  }
}

client --> istio_gw : HTTPS
istio_gw --> vs1 : route /svc1
istio_gw --> vs2 : route /svc2

vs1 --> svc1_svc
vs2 --> svc2_svc

svc1_svc --> svc1 : HTTP :8080
svc2_svc --> svc2 : HTTP :8080

svc2 --> svc1_svc : HTTP proxy\n--proxy-endpoint

svc1 --> tempo : OTLP/HTTP traces\n(otel exporter)
svc2 --> tempo : OTLP/HTTP traces\n(otel exporter)

note right of svc1
Single Go binary in container\nBuilt via multi-stage Dockerfile (ci/Dockerfile)
end note

note right of svc2
Single Go binary in container\nBuilt via multi-stage Dockerfile (ci/Dockerfile)
end note

@enduml

lengthAdjust="spacing" textLength="37.2246" x="534.8857" y="980.1455">traces</text><text fill="#000000" font-family="sans-serif" font-size="12" lengthAdjust="spacing" textLength="27.4453" x="475.0908" y="994.1143">(otel</text><text fill="#000000" font-family="sans-serif" font-size="12" lengthAdjust="spacing" textLength="3.8145" x="502.5361" y="994.1143"> </text><text fill="#000000" font-family="sans-serif" font-size="12" lengthAdjust="spacing" textLength="56.0801" x="506.3505" y="994.1143">exporter)</text></g></g></svg>
architecture_description:
## High-level architecture

### Runtime components (Kubernetes)
- **svc1 (Go / fuego HTTP API)**
  - Deployed as a containerized single Go binary (multi-stage build via `ci/Dockerfile`).
  - Exposes an HTTP API on **:8080** behind a **ClusterIP Service** `my-go-app-service:8080`.
  - Instrumented with **OpenTelemetry** (traces + metrics; metrics exporter includes stdout).

- **svc2 (Go / fuego HTTP API + proxy client)**
  - Also a containerized single Go binary.
  - Exposes an HTTP API on **:8080** behind a **ClusterIP Service** `my-go-app-service2:8080`.
  - Makes an **inter-service HTTP call** to svc1 using `--proxy-endpoint http://my-go-app-service:8080/svc1`.
  - Instrumented with **OpenTelemetry**.

### Traffic management / ingress
- **Istio Ingress Gateway** (`istio-ingress/ingress-gateway`) is the entry point for external client traffic.
- Two **Istio VirtualServices** route requests:
  - `vs-svc1` routes `/svc1` traffic to `my-go-app-service`.
  - `vs-svc2` routes `/svc2` traffic to `my-go-app-service2`.
- The repo also contains **Kubernetes Ingress** resources (2). In practice, Istio typically supersedes direct K8s Ingress; they are shown as present resources but the primary routing depicted is via Istio Gateway + VirtualServices.

### Observability dependency
- **Grafana Tempo** (in `monitoring` namespace) provides the distributed tracing backend.
- Both services export traces via **OTLP/HTTP** to `tempo-distributor.monitoring.svc.cluster.local:4318`.

### Key relationships
- Client → Istio Gateway (HTTPS)
- Istio Gateway → VirtualService (route selection)
- VirtualService → K8s Service → Pod/container (svc1/svc2)
- svc2 → svc1 (internal HTTP proxy call)
- svc1/svc2 → Tempo (OTLP/HTTP traces)
